txt_en: I think it’s the books that you read when you’re young that live with you forever.
txt_cn: 我想，你年轻时读过的书，才会陪伴你一生一世。
author: J·K·罗琳

txt_en: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
txt_cn: 爱情，是想象对理智的胜利。
author: H. L. Mencken

txt_en: I know for sure that what we dwell on is who we become.
txt_cn: 我确信，盘踞在我们脑中的思绪，决定了我们会成为怎样的人。
author: 奥普拉·温弗里

txt_en: Anything looked at closely becomes wonderful.
txt_cn: 在近距离的观察下，任何事物都会显得美妙无比。
author: A. R. Ammons

txt_en: If you want to succeed, you should strike out on new paths rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
txt_cn: 如果你想成功，就应该去开辟新路，而不是走大家公认的成功的老路。
author: John D. Rockefeller

txt_en: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses we must plant more trees.
txt_cn: 玫瑰不会从天而降，如果想要更多的玫瑰，必须自己去种。
author: George Eliot

txt_en: Don't cry when the sun is gone, because the tears won't let you see the stars.
txt_cn: 不要在太阳落下时哭泣，因为泪水会让你错过星星。
author: Violeta Parra

txt_en: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that's the stuff life is made of.
txt_cn: 你热爱生命吗？那就别浪费时间，因为生命是由时间构成的。
author: 本杰明·富兰克林

txt_en: Nothing is too small to know, and nothing is too big to attempt.
txt_cn: 没有事情会小到不值得了解，也没有什么事情会大到无法尝试。
author: William Van Horne

txt_en: Happiness is not a station you arrive at, but a manner of traveling.
txt_cn: 幸福并不是你所抵达的站点，而是一种旅行的方式。
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

txt_en: He who would travel happily must travel light.
txt_cn: 想要快乐旅行的人必须轻装上阵。
author: 安托万·德·圣埃克苏佩里

txt_en: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
txt_cn: 事情做完了就是做完了。别回头，继续去寻找下一个目标吧！
author: George C. Marshall

txt_en: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
txt_cn: 要想变得无可替代，就必须与众不同。
author: 可可·香奈儿

txt_en: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
txt_cn: 自信地朝你的梦想前进吧！去过你想要过的生活。
author: 亨利·戴维·梭罗

txt_en: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
txt_cn: 当一件事情足够重要时，即便缺乏胜算，你也会去做。
author: 伊隆·马斯克

txt_en: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
txt_cn: 知识会说话，但智慧是会倾听。
author: Jimi Hendrix

txt_en: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
txt_cn: 不愿在看不见海岸线的情况下久久漂流，是不会发现新大陆的。
author: 安德烈·纪德

txt_en: Luck is what you have left over after you give 100 percent.
txt_cn: 幸运，就是你付出百分之百后剩下的东西。
author: Langston Coleman

txt_en: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
txt_cn: 长得很慢的树，能结出最好的果子。
author: 莫里哀

txt_en: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
txt_cn: 困难能磨练心志，正如劳动能强壮体魄。
author: Seneca

txt_en: Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it.
txt_cn: 风筝逆风才能高飞——而不是顺风。
author: 温斯顿·丘吉尔

txt_en: There is an applause superior to that of the multitudes: one's own.
txt_cn: 有一种掌声，比大众的掌声更优裕：那就是你自己给自己鼓的掌。
author: Elizabeth Elton Smith

txt_en: Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change.
txt_cn: 改变你看待事物的方式，你所看到的事物也会改变。
author: Wayne W. Dyer

txt_en: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
txt_cn: 相信自己能成功，你就已经成功了一半。
author: Theodore Roosevelt

txt_en: A clear vision, backed by definite plans, gives you a tremendous feeling of confidence and personal power.
txt_cn: 一个清晰的愿景，加以明确计划的支持，会给你极大的信心和个人力量。
author: Brian Tracy
